workflow.name: Create viral storytelling videos with GPT, Gemini & JsonCut from text prompts
workflow.description:
## Generate ready-to-publish short-form videos from text prompts using AI

[![Video ansehen](fileId:2951)](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Cl0KwgRgcuBPVdGgL-nqAcheyvfVXttD/view)
*Click on the image to see the Example output in google drive*

Transform simple text concepts into professional short-form videos complete with AI-generated visuals, narrator voice, background music, and dynamic text overlays - all automatically generated and ready for Instagram, TikTok, or YouTube Shorts.

This workflow demonstrates a cost-effective approach to video automation by combining AI-generated images with audio composition instead of expensive AI video generation. Processing takes 1-2 minutes and outputs professional 9:16 vertical videos optimized for social platforms.

The template serves as both a showcase and building block for larger automation systems, with sticky notes providing clear guidance for customization and extension.

## Who's it for

Content creators, social media managers, and marketers who need consistent, high-quality video content without manual production work. Perfect for motivational content, storytelling videos, educational snippets, and brand campaigns.

## How it works

The workflow uses a form trigger to collect video theme, setting, and style preferences. [ChatGPT](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/chat) generates cohesive scripts and image prompts, while [Google Gemini](https://ai.google.dev/) creates themed background images and [OpenAI TTS](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text-to-speech) produces narrator audio. Background music is sourced from [Openverse](https://openverse.org/) for CC-licensed tracks. All assets are uploaded to [JsonCut API](https://jsoncut.com) which composes the final video with synchronized overlays, transitions, and professional audio mixing. Results are stored in [NocoDB](https://nocodb.com/) for management.

## How to set up

1. **JsonCut API**: Sign up at [jsoncut.com](https://jsoncut.com) and create an API key at [app.jsoncut.com](https://app.jsoncut.com). Configure HTTP Header Auth credential in n8n with header name `x-api-key`
2. **OpenAI API**: Set up credentials for script generation and text-to-speech
3. **Google Gemini API**: Configure access for Imagen 4.0 image generation  
4. **NocoDB** (Optional): Set up instance for video storage and configure database credentials

## Requirements

- [JsonCut](https://jsoncut.com) free account with API key
- [OpenAI API](https://platform.openai.com/) access for GPT and TTS
- [Google Gemini API](https://ai.google.dev/) for image generation
- [NocoDB](https://nocodb.com/) (optional) for result storage

## How to customize the workflow

This template is designed as a foundation for larger automation systems. The modular structure allows easy modification of AI prompts for different content niches (business, wellness, education), replacement of the form trigger with RSS feeds or database triggers for automated content generation, integration with social media APIs for direct publishing, and customization of visual branding through [JsonCut configuration](https://docs.jsoncut.com). 

The workflow can be extended for bulk processing, A/B testing multiple variations, or integration with existing content management systems. Sticky notes throughout the workflow provide detailed guidance for common customizations and scaling options.

parameters.content:
### Create Job with Jsoncut API and wait for the result
Alternatively, the JsonCut Community node can also be used (https://github.com/jsoncut/n8n-nodes-jsoncut).

parameters.jsonBody:
={
  "type": "video",
  "config": {
    "width": 1080,
    "height": 1920,
    "fps": 25,
    "format": "mp4",
    "audioTracks": [
      {
        "path": "{{ $json.upload_results[1].body.data.storageUrl }}",
        "mixVolume": 0.8,
        "start": 1,
        "cutFrom": 0,
        "cutTo": {{ $('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds }}
      },
      {
        "path": "{{ $json.upload_results[2].data.storageUrl }}",
        "mixVolume": 0.2,
        "start": 0,
        "cutFrom": 0
      }
    ],
    "defaults": {
      "layer": {
        "googleFont": "Montserrat:700",
        "textColor": "#ffffff",
        "fontSize": 54
      }
    },
    "clips": [
      {
        "duration": {{ $('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds + 2 }},
        "layers": [
          {
            "type": "fill-color",
            "color": "#000000"
          },
          {
            "type": "image-overlay",
            "path": "{{ $json.upload_results[0].storageUrl[0] }}",
            "start": 1,
            "stop": {{ 1 + ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 5) }},
            "zoomDirection": "in",
            "zoomAmount": 0.15,
            "height": 1,
            "opacity": 0.9
          },
          {
            "type": "image-overlay",
            "path": "{{ $json.upload_results[0].storageUrl[1] }}",
            "start": {{ 1 + ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 5) }},
            "stop": {{ 1 + ( ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 5) * 2 ) }},
            "zoomDirection": "right",
            "zoomAmount": 0.15,
            "height": 1,
            "opacity": 0.9
          },
          {
            "type": "image-overlay",
            "path": "{{ $json.upload_results[0].storageUrl[2] }}",
            "start": {{ 1 + ( ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 5) * 2 ) }},
            "stop": {{ 1 + ( ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 5) * 3 ) }},
            "zoomDirection": "left",
            "zoomAmount": 0.15,
            "height": 1,
            "opacity": 0.9
          },
          {
            "type": "image-overlay",
            "path": "{{ $json.upload_results[0].storageUrl[3] }}",
            "start": {{ 1 + ( ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 5) * 3 ) }},
            "stop": {{ 1 + ( ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 5) * 4 ) }},
            "zoomDirection": "out",
            "zoomAmount": 0.15,
            "height": 1,
            "opacity": 0.9
          },
          {
            "type": "image-overlay",
            "path": "{{ $json.upload_results[0].storageUrl[4] }}",
            "start": {{ 1 + ( ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 5) * 4 ) }},
            "stop": {{ $('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds + 1 }},
            "zoomDirection": "in",
            "zoomAmount": 0.15,
            "height": 1,
            "opacity": 0.9
          },
          {
            "type": "image-overlay",
            "path": "{{ $json.upload_results[3].data.storageUrl }}",
            "start": 1,
            "stop": {{ $('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds + 1 }},
            "position": "bottom",
            "width": 0.1,
            "height": 0.1,
            "zoomDirection": null
          },
          {
            "type": "title",
            "text": "{{ $('Generate content and Image Prompt').item.json.message.content.text_segments[0] }}",
            "start": 1,
            "stop": {{ 1 + ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 4) }},
            "position": "center",
            "zoomDirection": null
          },
          {
            "type": "title",
            "text": "{{ $('Generate content and Image Prompt').item.json.message.content.text_segments[1] }}",
            "start": {{ 1 + ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 4) }},
            "stop": {{ 1 + ( ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 4) * 2 ) }},
            "position": "center",
            "zoomDirection": null
          },
          {
            "type": "title",
            "text": "{{ $('Generate content and Image Prompt').item.json.message.content.text_segments[2] }}",
            "start": {{ 1 + ( ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 4) * 2 ) }},
            "stop": {{ 1 + ( ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 4) * 3 ) }},
            "position": "center",
            "zoomDirection": null
          },
          {
            "type": "title",
            "text": "{{ $('Generate content and Image Prompt').item.json.message.content.text_segments[3] }}",
            "start": {{ 1 + ( ($('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds / 4) * 3 ) }},
            "stop": {{ $('calculate audio duration').item.json.duration_seconds + 1 }},
            "position": "center",
            "zoomDirection": null
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}

values.content:
=You are a creative video director and scriptwriter for short-form social media videos (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts).  
Your task is to generate **cohesive and emotionally consistent content** based on a given *theme*:

```
{{ $json['Video Theme'] }}
```
and the *setting* (ignore if empty):
```
{{ $json['Video Setting'] || ""}}
```

Use the following Style for the background images (if not empty). Also keep the full style for each image prompt (e.g. is it a painting or photo?):
```
{{ $json['Image Style'] || ""}}
```

---

### GOAL
Create a concept for a 20‚Äì40 second video with consistent **visual style, tone, and lighting**, including:
1. **5 detailed prompts** for AI-generated background images  
2. **1 full narration text** (to be spoken by a narrator)  
3. **4 sequential text segments** that align perfectly with the narration (each about the same length, representing the same story flow)  
4. **1 short caption** for a social media post promoting this video  

---

### IMAGE PROMPT GUIDELINES
- Each image prompt should clearly describe the **scene**, **style**, **setting**, **mood**, **lighting**, and **color tone**.  
- All 5 images must feel visually and emotionally consistent.  
- Choose an appropriate general lighting mood (e.g. bright and hopeful, dark and moody, colorful and energetic, monochrome and calm).  
- Example structure for each image prompt:  
  *‚ÄúA cinematic photo of [subject/scene], [lighting type], [environment details], [emotion/feeling], [color palette/style].‚Äù*  
- Style examples: ‚Äúcinematic‚Äù, ‚Äúsoft focus‚Äù, ‚Äúwarm tones‚Äù, ‚Äúvolumetric light‚Äù, ‚Äúdreamy atmosphere‚Äù, etc.  

---

### TEXT CREATION GUIDELINES
- The full text should sound natural when spoken by a narrator.  
- It should flow smoothly and build emotional or motivational impact.  
- The 4 text segments should represent logical parts of the full narration (e.g. setup, reflection, climax, resolution).  
- Keep tone consistent with the image prompts (motivational, dramatic, peaceful, etc.).
- Do not use "-" or "‚Äî" (thinking / pause )

---

### OUTPUT FORMAT (JSON)
Return the result **only** as valid JSON structured like this:

```json
{
  "image_prompts": [
    "Prompt 1",
    "Prompt 2",
    "Prompt 3",
    "Prompt 4",
    "Prompt 5"
  ],
  "full_text": "Complete narration text here.",
  "text_segments": [
    "Part 1 text",
    "Part 2 text",
    "Part 3 text",
    "Part 4 text"
  ],
  "caption": "Short social media caption here."
}
```

example output:
{
  "image_prompts": [
    "A cinematic sunrise over misty mountains, golden light, hopeful tone, warm color palette",
    "A lone runner on a foggy trail, morning light breaking through clouds, determination and focus",
    "Close-up of hands tying running shoes, soft golden backlight, texture-rich realism",
    "Runner pushing through rain, dramatic contrast lighting, resilience mood",
    "A victorious silhouette at the mountain peak, glowing sky, triumphant energy"
  ],
  "full_text": "Every dream begins as a whisper. Most give up before the echo returns. But those who keep moving, step by step, turn the whisper into a roar. Keep going, your sunrise is closer than you think.",
  "text_segments": [
    "Every dream begins as a whisper.",
    "Most give up before the echo returns.",
    "But those who keep moving, step by step, turn the whisper into a roar.",
    "Keep going... your sunrise is closer than you think."
  ],
  "caption": "Don‚Äôt stop now, your sunrise is coming. üåÖ #motivation #dreambig"
}

parameters.content: ### Generate Script and Background Image Prompts

parameters.prompt: =Generate in the format 9:16 (no text in image): {{ $json['message.content.image_prompts'] }}

parameters.pythonCode:
import base64

# Get binary MP3 data from the input item
binary_data = _input.item.binary['data']
buffer = base64.b64decode(binary_data['data'])

def get_bitrate(bitrate_index, version, layer):
    bitrates = {
        'V1L3': [0, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80, 96, 112, 128, 160, 192, 224, 256, 320],
        'V2L3': [0, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80, 96, 112, 128, 144, 160],
    }
    table = bitrates['V1L3'] if version == 3 else bitrates['V2L3']
    return table[bitrate_index] * 1000

bitrate = 0
file_size = len(buffer)

# Scan for first MP3 frame header (starts with 0xFFE)
for i in range(len(buffer) - 4):
    if buffer[i] == 0xFF and (buffer[i + 1] & 0xE0) == 0xE0:
        version_bits = (buffer[i + 1] >> 3) & 0x03
        layer_bits = (buffer[i + 1] >> 1) & 0x03
        bitrate_index = (buffer[i + 2] >> 4) & 0x0F

        version = 3 if version_bits == 3 else 2
        layer = 3 - (layer_bits - 1)

        bitrate = get_bitrate(bitrate_index, version, layer)
        if bitrate > 0:
            break

if bitrate == 0:
    _input.item.json['duration_seconds'] = None
    _input.item.json['error'] = 'Could not detect bitrate'
    return _input.item

# Calculate duration: file size (bits) / bitrate
duration_seconds = (file_size * 8) / bitrate

# Write results into JSON
_input.item.json['duration_seconds'] = round(duration_seconds, 2)
_input.item.json['duration_minutes'] = round(duration_seconds / 60, 2)
_input.item.json['bitrate'] = bitrate
_input.item.json['file_size_bytes'] = file_size

return _input.item

values.placeholder: Enter the main theme or motto for your video (e.g., ‚ÄòEmbrace the small wins‚Äô for a motivational video).
Describe the setting or mood of the video (e.g., a calm, cozy evening with soft lighting for a relaxed, reflective feel).
Optional: Define the style of the background images (e.g. Watercolor Painting)

parameters.formDescription: Provide the core idea and the setting for your video. These details will guide the generation of a polished, ready-to-publish social media video.

parameters.content:
## Exmpe Form Input

1. General Video Theme:
Overcoming struggles / personal growth

2. Video Setting:
Introspective, deep thinking, sunrise or twilight moments, emotional reflection

3. Background Image Style: 
Watercolor painting with muted colors, low light

## Stores the final output in a new Table Row

### Row Content:
1. Theme
2. Setting
3. Style
4. Output Video File

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
